ivIilCRAY9FozawsNTu2TA.text: Presentation: beautiful! Chicken Panini: full of flavour Fries: perfectly crispy  Side Salad: fresh, delicious vinaigrette   Banana Creme Tarte: amazingly intricate! Service: lovely  Price: affordable,

photos.caption: Photo of Wanderlust Cafe & Bistro - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Wanderlust Cafe & Bistro - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Wanderlust Cafe & Bistro - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

39KBc2GOaW0Q7cqNp4qTqg.text: For a quick bite to eat, this was a great stop.  For breakfast, I had the scrambled eggs on brown bread toast.  For an afternoon pick-me-up, I had a fruit scone with a pot of tea.   Fresh and delicious food. Friendly, helpful staff.

rNVfYwlG98YGu_xCzNCSXg.text: We were here for some Scottish breakfast. I got Full Scottish breakfast and my wife got Eggs Benedict both were delicious. I tried Haggis for the first which comes with the full breakfast. The price was reasonable compared to quantity of food. The quality of food overpowered the quantity . If you are kinda hungry get few items .

RuHY3j0dRuQ3_pra27yi2Q.text: A great place to grab food! They serve breakfast food all day. The breakfast food is delicious! They have smoothies. It's not too expensive and they have WiFi. There are outlets to charge electronics.

RgO_DleO-VOc-4Hf3S6NIw.text: We've been here for breakfast, the choice is okay. Esecially the full Scottish Breakfast with Hagies and Black Pudding is very good! The cafe is not so big but clean and friendly.

X-1nMTp20TtoRkqUtoIlhg.text: Excellent espresso drinks. Food quality solid and generally tasty. Travel companion found eggs Benedict delicious. We would happily eat here again

sFuNDT75TDUCz-0qOcurUA.text: Very reasonable price for a full Scottish breakfast. Food was delicious (some of the best black pudding and haggis I've ever had). Worth the trip farther down the royal mile.  The restaurant was clean, service was great. They make fresh pressed juices, wish I'd tried one. They looked great!

photos.caption: Photo of Wanderlust Cafe & Bistro - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Scottish breakfast.

Qehr-i4Zfrt9nUgOv_edLQ.text: The eggs Benedict breakfast was very good and the service was really nice. They offer wheat free breakfast options as well, which is helpful. The coffee wasn't strong enough for me, but the cafe itself was very cute.

photos.caption: Photo of Wanderlust Cafe & Bistro - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Eggs Benedict on wheat free bread. Very good!

QhnYCzBnNe97kbcWeJHdwg.text: A recently opened new coffee shop on the Royal Mile. It's conveniently located for anyone needing a rest from walking from the castle down to Holyrood.  The personell is very friendly and efficient.  The cakes are served with a personal touch. I ordered a brownie and got the whole deal, a brownie served  with cream and chocolate sauce and chocolate buds and  a joke by the waiter. The hot chocolate was tasty enough although I would recommend a touch more chocolate to be added to the milk. Prices are not cheap, but then it's acceptable for the area. For a peppermint tea you pay 3. The interior is modern with a rustical touch.  Its a good place to also meet friends for coffee and enjoy some social time.

photos.caption: Photo of Wanderlust Cafe & Bistro - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Hot chocolate
Photo of Wanderlust Cafe & Bistro - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Brownie

PEE3yKvW9-vTr2hFD0EKcw.text: Good was mediocre. Waitress was maybe new and inexperienced and provided poor service. Forgot our drinks, gave our daughter the wrong order and had to make several trips because she would leave before listening to us about the other things she had forgotten (like cutlery and napkins) and never brought the water we requested when first sitting down. It happens and all that can be overlooked with a little politeness. But she was abrupt and then argued about our daughters order blaming her.

gYqifLyXpU2KSJdhvDeROA.text: Had the Full Scottish breakfast. It was delicious. Good service, small seating capacity. Nicely decorated.

fxYPPeASSuUBuirL4Wk3Ww.text: A great little cafe on Canongate and slightly set apart from the touristy madness of the Royal Mile.  Great for a quick bacon buttie, or if your looking for something more filling - Scottish porridge, sweet or savoury crepes, or a full Scottish breakfast - then I highly recommend it.  Friendly and efficient staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Wanderlust Cafe & Bistro - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Wanderlust Cafe & Bistro - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Wanderlust Cafe & Bistro - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The menu

nANfM46O1df5zyLvWUx0AA.text: The savory New York crepe was incredibly delicious. I wasn't crazy about the oat in the freshly made smoothie, but that was my own fault since I knew that going in and should have picked a different option, many of which appealed to me. The decor was pleasant with clean new wood walls and artistically spaced greenery, and the view of the old stone building across the street is fun to study through the window. Staff was efficient.

0ILl9AYguJf1DjqItKLcEA.text: Great breakfast in a cute little restaurant on the Royal Mile. Pancakes were delicious, and the fresh squeezed orange juice and apple juice was so good. Eggs Benedict was perfectly cooked. Friendly service, fun theming, and clean restaurant.
